snippet: More than 500,000 people are estimated to soon lose food stamps as states reimpose time limits and work requirements that were suspended in recent years because of high unemployment.
abstract: Government officials and advocates for poor warn moves by states across nation to reinstate time limits and work requirements on food assistance programs could result in hundreds of thousands of people in United States losing food stamps; limits and requirements, dating back to 1996, were waived in wake of recession to address high national unemployment rate.
lead_paragraph: More than 500,000 people are estimated to soon lose food stamps as states reimpose time limits and work requirements that were suspended in recent years because of high unemployment.

headline.main: Thousands Could Lose Food Stamps as States Restore Pre-Recession Requirements
headline.print_headline: Thousands Could Lose Food Stamps as States Restore Requirements

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Center on Budget and Policy Priorities
